|Title=Knowing the definition of a rare disease
|Description=A rare disease has a prevalence of < 1/2000. 80% of rare diseases are genetic in origin.
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Sylvie Odent
|Order=1}}

Rare disease: a disease that affects less than one person in 2,000 in the general population (definition from the European Regulation on Orphan Medicinal Products).

question.title: What is the prevalence threshold for a disease to be considered rare?
question.description: A disease that affects less than one person in 2,000 in the general population is considered rare.

option_a.description: A disease that affects less than one person in 1,000 in the general population is considered rare.

option_b.description: A disease that affects less than one person in 2,000 in the general population is considered rare.

option_c.description: A disease that affects less than one person in 5,000 in the general population is considered rare.

option_d.description: A disease that affects less than one person in 500 in the general population is considered rare.

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter for the answer
